---
pagetitle: Limits of an Array of Numbers
example:
  title: Limits of an Array of Numbers Part 2
  instructions: >
    Change only one line so that the function takes an arbitrary number of
    numbers instead of an array of numbers so that the following gives the
    same answer as in part one.
  runtime: repl_js
  initial:
    js: |-
      let limits = (values) => {
        if (!values.length) {
          return [undefined, undefined]
        }
        let low = values[0]
        let high = values[0]
        for (let v of values) {
          if (v < low) low = v
          if (v > high) high = v
        }
        return [low, high]
      }

      const numbers = [1, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21]
      console.log(limits(numbers))
  solution:
    js: |-
      let limits = (...values) => {
        if (!values.length) {
          return [undefined, undefined]
        }
        let low = values[0]
        let high = values[0]
        for (let v of values) {
          if (v < low) low = v
          if (v > high) high = v
        }
        return [low, high]
      }

      const numbers = [1, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21]
      console.log(limits(numbers))
output: js4shiny::html_document_plain
